title: Labyrinth (1986)(Marvel)
description:
Labyrinth (1986)
"Where everything seems possible and nothing is what it seems."

This is a comic book adaptation of the fantasy film Labyrinth released in 1986 and directed by Jim Henson.
The film featured David Bowie and Jennifer Connely in the main roles. It also featured Bowie&#039;s music.

The Story:
"The story is about a girl whose baby brother is taken away to the center of a labyrinth, and her journey to get him back from the king of the goblins AKA David Bowie."

This adaptation was released as a three issue mini-series in late 1986 and early 1987.

The Credits:
Adapted by Sid Jacobson
Breakdowns by John Buscema (This means the art is beautiful )
Finished art by Romeo Tanghal
Lettered by Joe Rosen
Colored by Bob Sharen (issue #1) & Julianna Ferriter (issues #2-3)
Edited by Bob Budiansky
Editor-in-chief: Jim Shooter
